title: N2O4 NO2 equil - P of NO2 if N2O4 is 1.33atm -calc

Kp = 3.0 at 70°C

colorless

brown

A mixture of NO2(g) and N2O4(g) is placed in a glass tube and allowed to reach equilibrium at 70°C, as represented above.

If <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mi>P</mi> <mrow> <msub> <mi>N</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <msub> <mi>O</mi> <mn>4</mn> </msub> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A86@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is 0.64 atm when the system is at equilibrium at 70°C, what is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mi>P</mi> <mrow> <mi>N</mi> <msub> <mi>O</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3990@</annotation> </semantics> </math>?

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
